newsitem.title: USA: Medtronic, Biotronik say reach settlement.
newsitem.headline: Medtronic, Biotronik say reach settlement.

text.p: All patent and trademark litigation pending in German courts between Medtronic Inc and Biotronik GmbH & Co has been settled, the companies said.
They said they agreed on a one-year stay of all litigation in U.S. courts as negotiations continue toward settlement.
Medtronic and Biotronik said they agreed to a cross-license on their patent portfolios related to pacemakers and defibrillators for treatment of abnormal heart rhythms.
The license is worldwide with the exception of the United States, where negotiations continue.

In litigation that began in Germany in 1993, each company alleged infringement by the other of certain patents covering implantable devices used in treatment of bradycardia and tachyarrhythmia and infringement of certain trademarks used to identify bradycardia products, the companies said.
